newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Repco down after chief executive charged.
newsitem.headline: Repco down after chief executive charged.

text.p: Shares of Repco Holdings Bhd fell sharply on Tuesday following news that its chief executive has been charged with a securities law violation, dealers said.
Shares of the timber and gaming firm were down 3.00 ringgit to 83, after falling as low as 80 ringgit earlier.
Choo Chin Thye pleaded not guilty on Monday to a charge under the Securities Industry Act of giving a misleading statement on January 27, 1996.
"I think that (the charge) is the main reason the stock is down," said one dealer, noting that other Second Board stocks were trading higher.
Choo's signature appears on a letter dated January 27, 1996 which was sent to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange outlining a profit forecast for the years ended June 30, 1996 and June 30, 1997.

The forecast was withdrawn a week later, and a lower projection was issued. Repco said in the revised letter that it had prematurely assumed approvals for a new gaming licence which were still pending.
Repco officials were not available for comment on Tuesday.
